title: Paedophile hunters 'overstepped the mark' by falsely imprisoning suspected child sex offenders, court hears
text:
Paedophile hunters "overstepped the mark" when they falsely imprisoned and attacked two men that they suspected of being child sex offenders, a court has heard.

The group, called Predator Exposure, confronted the men on separate occasions after they had taken part in online chats with group members posing as teenagers.

The members, who live-streamed the confrontations on social media, detained and verbally abused both men and used unnecessary violence against one, who was held in a headlock and physically dragged out of a shop against his will, Leeds Crown Court heard.

The six defendants - including 26-year-old Jordan Plain from Leeds and 52-year-old Dean Walls from Moortown - deny the offences and claim they were making lawful citizen's arrests.

The first incident happened in August 2018, when four of the defendants went to the West Yorkshire home of a man who had taken part in online conversations with a Predator Exposure member posing as a 14-year-old.
